title: The twists and turns of Trump's military strategy
subhead: Venezuela, Greenland, Iran... Behind Donald Trump's martial rhetoric, Washington has forged a strategy of targeted strikes and simultaneous operations, running the risk of stretching its military capabilities too thin.

title: Germany is questioning the future of the European project
subhead: Berlin is expressing doubt about the European Union's ability to withstand the rise of nationalist parties and the pressure from the Trump administration. This unprecedented skepticism in Germany has raised fears of lasting weakening, or even the gradual marginalization, of Europe as it exists today.

title: Benedictine nuns of Montmartre 'under duress' for 40 years, report finds
subhead: An independent investigation, commissioned by the congregation, reveals that Mother Marie-Agn√®s, the congregational prioress general, ruled through an atmosphere of 'terror and suspicion.' The control of food and of women's weight was central to the superior's domination.

After celebrating Maduro ouster, Venezuelan migrants in US fear what lies ahead
subhead: After celebrating the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, Venezuelan asylum seekers in the US have begun to have doubts. In Denver, Colorado, where they number in the tens of thousands, many now fear having to go back to their country with the Chavistas still in power.

title: How France's fixation with decline serves the Trumpian narrative
subhead: As the threat posed by the United States grows, narratives of decline have gained traction in France, setting the stage for a presidential campaign centered on the power of France and Europe.

title: Long before coveting Greenland, the US expanded by opening its checkbook
subhead: From the early 19th century on, the United States expanded by acquiring territory through purchase or force. By expressing interest in Greenland, Donald Trump has revived that tradition.
